column4: stumped! -> "mount: block device /dev/scd0 is write-protected, mounting read only  mount: mount point /media/cdrom0 is not a directory"
Did you check your /etc/fstab entree for your cdrom drive ? You might have it mounted there as read-only
I even added rw options to see if that would help - but I saw online that many people do not have rw for the CDROM options so I removed it - either way, adding rw dd not help
